website_summaries.verdict: A compact set of rollers great for traveling to cycling events.
pros: In addition to being lightweight, the aluminum drums spin quietly with magnetic resistance
Easily foldable to store or bring to race weekends for warmup
cons: Some reports that these rollers can break after some use

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was clearly an open box item that had been used.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It has been great for him to have the option to bike indoors ...
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son got this as a birthday gift and he absolutely loves it. It has been great for him to have the option to bike indoors when the weather is cold and the roads are snowy. It did take some time for him to get the hang of using it, though. It takes quite a bit of coordination so I made him learn in a space where I knew he couldn't damage anything. That being said, he is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise tool with bike.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son for Christmas and he loves it. He said it takes some getting used to to keep his balance. He placed it in a doorway to start getting his balance. He says it is a great workout to use in the winter and will be in shape come spring to do some distance riding. He sent me a video of himself riding it and it did look like fun plus a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe lover

customer_reviews.title: I MADE YOUTUBE VIDS ABOUT THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: UNBOXING of CycleOps AL Rollers  SUCCESS at Riding the Rollers  THE INITIAL FAIL at Riding the Rollers  I am no elite cyclist. Once you get the hang of riding them, they are quite fun and engaging to ride; you cannot just zone out and mindlessly ride. Surprisingly, there is true resistance through the whole pedaling rotation, leading to an even better workout. So it's not like you can mud your way through a push and the top of the rotation. (I did not get the resistance add-on) I HIGHLY recommend this. It's just a fun ass workout. Enjoy the videos!
customer_reviews.author: Zakya Warkēno

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA, sturdy, quite, folds up for storage, life time warranty, and is $100 dollars cheaper than its competitor. What are you waiting for "get on your bikes and ride". The balancing learning curve is about two or three sessions, then you should have no problems riding non stop(without putting your foot down or holding the wall).
customer_reviews.author: reviewinator

customer_reviews.title: OMG this thing is Scary
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Highly recommend this for anyone that wants to train indoors. It's really scary at first, but once you get used to it, its not so bad. I had to have something to hold onto when starting off and stopping. A little hint: make sure the front roller isn't too far ahead of the front wheel.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jared

customer_reviews.title: The Cycleops Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an indoor trainer that would be simple to set up and use and the Cycleops is perfect. It needs very little space, takes no time at all to set up and you don't have to do anything to your bike to use it. It takes a little practice to get going but if you can ride a bike, you can ride rollers! I have mine set up between my bed and the wall so getting started is easier. The Cycleops is the best indoor fitness item I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: G. G. Mason

customer_reviews.title: There are better rollers
customer_reviews.text: One of the rubber feet ha broke. There is also a humming noise would like to return it
customer_reviews.author: Judd

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed. Aluminum is much nicer than the old plastic rollers of years past. Storage and transportation is a snap with the quick fold over.
customer_reviews.author: Airbus Driver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it.. specially during winter ... it helps a lot
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best investment since I stop riding a bike .. great cardio home workout
customer_reviews.author: D-dubs

customer_reviews.title: amazing trainer
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 15 minutes to get the hang of riding on this trainer. I started in a doorway as suggested and now ride next to my treadmill, as it helps to have something to hold on to when first starting out. That being said....I had my son try the trainer out when he came for a visit and he had no issues, was able to balance right away. The work out is amazing. i bought this one for my daughter for christmas..
customer_reviews.author: KU Fan

customer_reviews.title: Cyleops
customer_reviews.text: Love them.. took me a little bit to be able to do them without holding on to the wa but once your able to do it once you can everytime. great for bike handling skills.. feels much more like you are on a bike than when you're on a trainer
customer_reviews.author: teresa colmenero

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for training and indoor cycling
customer_reviews.text: Long story short: I owned KurtKinetic standard, KurtKinetick RockNRoll, and the mightly ProForm TDF for a whopping $1500 USD. Yeah, none of those things live up to how awesome this thing is. Simple, effective, great training, great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kwj

customer_reviews.title: shipped quickly and arrived as advertised
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these rollers work great. I don't feel like a thousand dollar set could work that much better for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P Byer

customer_reviews.title: not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Trainer arived with loose parts missing parts no instructions had to figure out assembly go to hard wear store for specialized psrts. Trainer makes alot of noise not a fine tune trainer dont waste you money
customer_reviews.author: richard solansky

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, quick to set up, just wish for more adjustment in wheel base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the first ride.
customer_reviews.text: These rollers broke on the first ride. The rear roller would continue to slip against the frame after the initial break. I'm 170 lbs cyclist and did not these hard. I could not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Hardcastle

customer_reviews.title: I returned it. I found it to be too ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. I found it to be too difficult to balance my bicycle on the rollers.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these rollers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these second hand, and am happy with the CycleOps rollers. They work well, they are low profile, lightweight, fold-able, and relatively quiet. I ride these with a fixed gear without difficulty. A nice alternative to trainers that hold your rear wheel, as these force you to balance and ride smoothly. The band can be changed if its stretched.
customer_reviews.author: algreen

customer_reviews.title: Much more enjoyable than a regular Trainer stand
customer_reviews.text: Have had these rollers for 10+ years. Just now replacing the rubber band and bearings. Only mild complaint is that stuff from my tires gets left on the aluminum rollers, which then have to be cleaned off. Getting comfortable on rollers definitely takes practice at first. Would recommend putting them on a surface where you're ok if you come off the rollers the wheels wont leave marks on whatever is below. (I burned a mark in the carpet from a spinning wheel one time when I came off the rollers).
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I've had mine for eight years and love it --- all the original parts
customer_reviews.text: Hardy: I've had mine for eight years and love it --- all the original parts. Some days, it gets moved with my carbon bike from about -20'F below temps to above 65'F temp when I bring them in from the foyer. Very simple, folds up and away, provides AM/PM cardio, strength and balance.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: good product, well made, cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Smooth bearings. Nicely turned rollers. Durable framing, though some connective components look like potential weak spots but time will tell. Rolling noise minimal; watch tv/books on tape with volume 15% higher. I would suggest to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie
